intro: Bonatea porrecta, commonly known as the narrowleaf bonatea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and shrublands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Bonatea porrecta is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
